title: ReVision: A Dataset and Baseline VLM for Privacy-Preserving Task-Oriented Visual Instruction Rewriting
author: Abhijit Mishra (University of Texas at Austin), Richard Noh (University of Texas at Austin), Hsiang Fu (University of Texas at Austin), Mingda Li (Yale University), Minji Kim (University of Texas at Austin)
background: This research focuses on transforming multimodal commands (text and images) into text-only instructions to enable effective and privacy-preserving on-device interaction.
contribution: ReVision introduces a novel dataset and a compact vision-language model for Visual Instruction Rewriting, enhancing privacy in task-oriented multimodal interactions.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Prior models for multimodal tasks predominantly rely on large cloud-based systems, risking user privacy when handling sensitive visual data.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves on existing frameworks by providing a lightweight, on-device model that rewrites visual instructions into structured text, minimizing data transmission risks.

key_innovation: Employs a compact vision-language model that integrates visual context into rewriting task-oriented instructions, fundamentally prioritizing device-side data processing.
real_world_impact: The study aims to enhance user privacy in daily interactions with augmented and virtual reality devices and smartphones, promoting secure data practices while executing complex tasks.
limitations: The model may struggle with interpreting fine-grained visual details due to downsampling, which could limit its effectiveness in information-dense contexts.

new_terms.task-oriented multimodal interaction: **Task-oriented multimodal interaction** refers to the process of understanding and executing commands that involve multiple forms of input, such as voice and visual cues.
new_terms.Visual Instruction Rewriting: **Visual Instruction Rewriting** is a technique developed to translate visual commands into structured text commands for systems that process natural language.

open_sourcing: The Code, Dataset, and Models have been released for academic use.
